Summary: doxorubicinol activates ATP5 (ATP5C1P1, ATP5F1A, ATP5F1B, ATP5F1C, ATP5F1D, ATP5F1E, ATP5ME, ATP5PB, ATP5PD).
Biochemical reaction from doxorubicin to doxorubicinol. This interaction can be catalyzed by CBR3, CBR1, AKR1C3 or AKR1A1.
Biochemical reaction from doxorubicin to 7-deoxydoxorubicinone, reactive oxygen species.
Biochemical reaction from doxorubicin to reactive nitrogen species. This interaction can be catalyzed by NOS1, NOS2 or NOS3.
Biochemical reaction from doxorubicin to reactive oxygen species. This interaction can be catalyzed by RAC2, CYBA or NCF4.
doxorubicin-Iron (II) complex (doxorubicin, iron(2+)) inhibits iron hemostasis [GO:0006879].
doxorubicin leads to doxorubicin-Iron (II) complex (doxorubicin, iron(2+)).
reactive nitrogen species leads to disruption of nitric oxide [GO:0045019].
ATP5 (ATP5C1P1, ATP5F1A, ATP5F1B, ATP5F1C, ATP5F1D, ATP5F1E, ATP5ME, ATP5PB, ATP5PD) leads to mitochondrial dysfunction [MEDDRA:10053961].
AKR1A1 leads to doxorubicin-Iron (II) complex (doxorubicin, iron(2+)).
calcium hemostasis [GO:0055074] leads to mitochondrial dysfunction [MEDDRA:10053961].
reactive oxygen species leads to mitochondrial dysfunction [MEDDRA:10053961].
Transport from calcium to calcium. This interaction is catalyzed by ATP2A2.
